RackMap is a software solution for datacenter and server room asset management.

user's level, level 0 indicates an anonymous user (not registered), level 1 indicates a basic user, level 10 indicates an administrator with full access rights

In this form you can manage the different users' groups.

In this form you can manage the different users allowed to access the system. For each user you can choose a name, a password and an access level. Level 0 indicates an anonymous user (not registered), level 1 a basic user (e.g.: a student), level 10 an administrator with full access rights
Send results to users by email
With this form you can import users and groups from XML or CSV (tab delimited text) file. The file formats are the same as the ones obtained by exporting data from the Users Selection form.
In order to access the different sections of RackMap you must log in using the name and password provided to you by the system administrator
This form shows the users currently logged
In this form you can see and select the registered users. You can change the displayed sequence by clicking on the column names.

This page allows you to make and restore database backups (works only on POSIX systems with MySQL or PostgreSQL). Push the [backup] button to create a new RackMap database dump in compressed SQL format (structure and data). To restore an existing backup archive, select it and push the [restore] button. Note that before each restore the system automatically execute a new backup, so you can undo the operation. Backup files are stored on the "cache/backup" folder using the following syntax: YYYYMMDDhhmmss_rackmap_backup.sql.gz , where YYYYMMDDhhmmss are the digits of year (Y), month (M), day (D), hour (h), minutes (m), seconds (s).
With this form you can change your access password.
With this form you can change your email. A verification message will be sent to your new email address. Your account will be disabled until confirmation receipt.
click on this link to access on this system

This page allows you to insert a multimedia file object in the current description. Select the object you want to insert, fill description fields and click the [add] button.

Import MAC and IP addresses from DHCP dump
With this form you can import MAC and IP addresses from DHCP dump data file. To create the DHCP dump file you can use the command: dhcpdump -i eth0 > dhcpdata.txt
Import object data from GetOS scan
With this form you can import object data from a GetOS file.

With this form you can manage configuration and SSH command templates. A template name starts wit #~ and ends with the ~# character sequence. The objects and attributes names must be always in uppercase with only letters from A to Z and numbers from 0 to 9. You can also use the * character that indicates any letter from A to Z or any number from 0 to 9. Templates examples: #~OBJNAME~# : object name; #~OBJDESCRIPTION~# : object description; #~OBJLABEL~# : object label; #~OBJTAG~# : object tag or serial number; #~ATTRIBUTE_ABC~# : attribute ABC; #~CHILD_ABC_OBJNAME~# : name of the child object ABC; #~CHILD_ABC_OBJDESCRIPTION~# : description of the child object ABC; #~CHILD_ABC_OBJLABEL~# : label of the child object ABC; #~CHILD_ABC_OBJTAG~# : tag or serial number of the child object ABC; #~CHILD_ABC_ATTRIBUTE_EFG~# : attribute EFG of the child object ABC. Note: use the SSH prefix for SSH templates.
With this form you can generate configuration scripts based on templates and object attributes. Select objects to process and the templates to apply, then click on the [generate] button.
select objects using this filtering data
With this form you can bulk change the same attribute on multiple objects.
use this command to do a hard reset on the system - the operating system will not be shutdown properly!
use the this command to initiate a soft-shutdown of the OS via ACPI
use this command to turn off the power of the system - the operating system will not be shutdown properly!
use this command to power on the system
This page display information on selected datacenter.
This page shows the map of the selected suite. Each square represent a rack, click on it to display details.
This page shows all the objects installed on the selected rack. Click on a object to display details.
This page shows the details of the selected object and its child objects.
turns on the UID Light for 30 seconds
With this form you can manage connections between objects.
this connection has been already entered

the objects must be different - you cannot create a loop on the same object

With this form you can generate a script to send bulk "expect" commands to multiple servers based on templates and object attributes. Select objects to process and the templates to apply, then click on the [generate] button. WARNING: when selecting objects be sure they are all of the same type and the right SSH header and footer are selected. When generated, download the script and delete the copy on server, check it and mark it as executable.
color used to represent this object type on graphs
With this form you can manage the connection types (physical cable conenctions or virtual conenctions between objects).
With this form you can add child objects in bulk.

With this form you can export RackMap data in several formats. The "exclude" field allows you to remove some fields from the output. You can use the following keywords to exclude fields from the output of the report. Use these keywords in a space separated list in the exclude field of the form: * user: removes any reference to any field containing the word user, for example an ILO username; * password: removes any reference to a field containing the word password, an example is the iLO password.; * license: removes any reference to any field containing the word license, for instance a software license or ILO upgrade license; * child: removes any reference to an object that is part of larger device or parent, for example hard drive, PSU, processor, RAM module etc; * connection: removes the connection section for example power, virtual or network connections between objects; * permissions: Removes all permission tables relating to objects; * object: removes any detailed information about every child and parent object - only the reports such as rack view and capacity will be displayed; * capacity: this removes the capacity report from the export. ** Note: You can add any other field in the system to exclude, however the above are the main fields recommended for use.
comma or space separated list of field pattern to exclude from results
set this option to true if the object is virtual (not a physical object)
SSH Key to be installed on remote servers

RackMap uses a 2-step verification process that requires you to enter two pieces of information before you can access the system. The required information is the standard RackMap password and the verification code generated by your smartphone. This prevents hackers from accessing your account if they only have your password or phone. However, it also means that you will always need to have your phone at hand whenever you want to login to your RackMap Account.

You must download and install the Google Authenticator app on your smartphone. When you have downloaded and installed the app you can use the following code, or scan the QR-Code:
One Time Password code generated using your smartphone application

TO CONFIRM THE REGISTRATION USE THE FOLLOWING LINK:
#SUBSCRIBEURL#
